description.narrative: • Short general project overviewThe HERMANA project, which stands for “HERramienta para el MANejo integral del Agua” was initiated in August 2017 and completed in September 2019. The project was a collaboration between Deltares (who led the project), the Dutch Water Authorities (DWA), HydroLogic and FutureWater in the Netherlands, and the Corporación Autónoma Regional del Valle del Cauca (CVC) in Colombia. HERMANA combines real-time data and forecasts on meteorological, hydro(geo)logical, and water quality data, and includes drought indices based on satellite data. All this data is collected and deployed into a web-based platform to support integrated water management decision-making. HERMANA allows to combine weather and water data with models and local knowledge of the ground- and surface water system, such as exceedance thresholds for discharges or water quality parameters, and to generate customized dashboards, reports, overviews, forecasts and warnings tailored to the needs of water authorities and their stakeholders. The HERMANA dashboards support daily, operational and tactical decision-making related to water resources in the Cauca Valley. According to CVC, the main added value of the HERMANA solution is that provides them ready to use information for key decision-making processes. The co-design approach and mapping their decision-making processes, were the key activities to build HERMANA.The HERMANA solution developed and implemented in the frame of this project is of significant interest to the co-financer and client, CVC. This interest is witnessed by the fact that this regional authority purchased an HERMANA subscription after the project to continue with HERMANA.• What are the results of the projectThe main objective of this project was to develop an integrated water management decision support system, the HERMANA solution, which enables CVC to analyse the current and future status of the water system and hydrometeorological hazards and to substantiate (operational and tactical) decisions related to water management in the Cauca Valley. The following results were achieved:- Identified the information needs and key water management decision processes that are undertaken by CVC to fulfill its mandate;- Developed flowcharts distilling the information needs and decision-making steps needed to respond to given water management challenges;- Adapted and integrated existing data sources, tools and models available for the region in order to cover most of the information needs of CVC related to water management;- Integrated existing systems of FEWS-IDEAM, InfoSequía, GeoCVC with the technology offered by the HydroNET platform to create the HERMANA solution;- Included ground-based measurements from monitoring networks, modelled and satellite data, and water quantity, water quality, surface water, groundwater and climatological information;- Designed the HERMANA solution with CVC to implement tailored user interfaces that can be integrated in their daily operation (and tactical) water management tasks.
